intro: Matelea pueblensis, commonly known as the Puebla mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
